title: Why does music help with depression? - Quora

response.answer_text: If I’m really depressed, I will only choose music that will make me more depressed. It’s how the monster feeds itself. I’ve never found music to be helpful as a way of getting out of real depression. However, at other times, I can use music to temporarily experience certain very dark emotions - and then I can change the music to get out of it. Like - I might choose to visit Depressionland for an hour or two, and then come back. It feels like it’s beneficial when I do it. Maybe it’s about being in control, or just a need to check in, to see if things are the way I remember them… I dunno. But it does seem to satisfy a need.
When a person is depressed the mind is in turmoil, music can be very soothing and also gets one’s mind off of the pain a person may be feeling.
